checkpoint.name: Check for there is no seepage , Cracks, chipping of plaster
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: check corners, false ceiling.

checkpoint.name: No unnecessary items in sterile zone
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No slabs, almirah, storing unnecessary items like drums, equipment, instruments not required for immediate procedures are kept in sterile zone

checkpoint.name: Department is painted/whitewashed in uniform colour &plastered & painted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: painted in soothing colours like light green or light blue. Not bright colours.

checkpoint.name: Floors, walls, roof, roof tops, sinks patient care and circulation areas are Clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: All area are clean with no dirt,grease,littering and cobwebs

checkpoint.name: Surface of furniture and fixtures are clean
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: look for dirt above OT light, behind stationary equipment.

checkpoint.name: No condemned/Junk material in the OT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: no partial compliance.

checkpoint.name: No pests and rodent are noticed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No lizard, cockroach, mosquito, flies, rats, bird nest etc.

checkpoint.name: OT has facility to provide sufficient and clean linen for surgical patient
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Drape, draw sheet, cut sheet and gown

checkpoint.name: OT has facility to provide linen for staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT dress, gown. Separate OT dress for OT staff.

checkpoint.name: Linen is changed after each procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Bed sheets, draw sheets and Macintosh.

checkpoint.name: There is system to check the cleanliness and Quantity of the linen received from laundry
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT tech/Nurse checks Number of linen, cleanliness, whether is torned or stained

checkpoint.name: Up to date instructions for operation and maintenance of equipment are readily available with staff.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: if operator doesn't understand English, then instructions should be in local language.

checkpoint.name: All the measuring equipment/ instrument are calibrated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Boyels apparatus, cautery, BP apparatus, autoclave etc. There is system to label/ code the equipment to indicate status of calibration/ verification when recalibration is due

checkpoint.name: There is system of timely corrective break down maintenance of the equipment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Back up for critical equipment. label Defective/Out of order equipment and stored appropriately until it has been repaired

checkpoint.name: All equipment are covered under AMC including preventive maintenance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: look for MOU and visit records of the empanelled agency.

checkpoint.name: Staff is skilled for cleaning, inspection & trouble shooting in case equipment malfunction
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: E.g. when to change water of batteries, when to oil, change fuse, replace filters etc.

checkpoint.name: Check for Case Sheet if drugs are prescribed under generic name only
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check at least 5 case sheets selected randomly

checkpoint.name: Check Case Sheet that drugs are prescribed as per STG
Check staff is aware of the drug regime and doses as per STG
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if drugs are prescribed as per STG in at least 5 case sheets selected randomly

checkpoint.name: Operative Notes are Recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Name of person in attendance during procedure, Pre and post operative diagnosis, Procedures carried out, length of procedures, estimated blood loss, Fluid administered, specimen removed, complications etc.

checkpoint.name: Anaesthesia Notes are Recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: notes includes Anaesthesia type, induction, airway, intubation, inhalation agents, epidural, spial, allergies, IV lines, IV fluids, regional block.

checkpoint.name: Registers and records are maintained as per guidelines
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT Register, Schedule, Infection control records, autoclaving records etc

checkpoint.name: All register/records are identified and numbered
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Register are labelled and numbered.

checkpoint.name: Standard Formats are available
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Consent forms, Anaesthesia form, surgical safety check list

checkpoint.name: Safe keeping of patient records
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Records are kept in place without seepage, moisture, termite, pests.

checkpoint.name: Records of Monitoring/ Assessments are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: PAC, Intraoperative monitoring

checkpoint.name: Treatment plan, first orders are written on Case Sheet
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Treatment prescribed in nursing records

checkpoint.name: There is procedure of handing over while receiving patient from OT to Maternity Wards and SNCU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Transfer Register is maintained.

checkpoint.name: There is procedure for Pre Operative assessment
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Physical examination, results of lab investigation, X-Rays, diagnosis and proposed surgery

checkpoint.name: Any major or minor transfusion reaction is recorded and reported to responsible person
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: After transfusion, Reaction form is returned back to blood bank, even when there is no reaction.

checkpoint.name: Availability of blood units in case of emergency with out replacement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: The blood is ordered for the patient according to the MSBOS (Maximum Surgical Blood Order Schedule)

checkpoint.name: Consent is taken before transfusion
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Duly signed by patient/next of kin

checkpoint.name: Patient's identification is verified before transfusion
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least two identifiers are used.

checkpoint.name: Protocol of blood transfusion is monitored & regulated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: blood is kept on optimum temperature before transfusion. Blood transfusion is monitored and regulated by qualified person

checkpoint.name: Intraoperative care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for measures taken to prevent Supine Hypotension (Use of pillow/Sandbag to tilt the uterus), Technique for Incision, Opening of Uterus, Delivery of Foetus and placenta, and closing of Uterine Incision

checkpoint.name: Proper selection Anaesthesia technique
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check Both General and Spinal Anaesthesia Options are available. Ask for what are the criteria for using spinal and GA. Regional block and epidural anaesthesia used wherever required/indicated

checkpoint.name: pre operative care and part preparation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Haemoglobin level is estimated , and arrangement of Blood, Catheterization, Administration of Antacids Proper cleaning of perineal area before procedure with antisepsis

checkpoint.name: Post operative care
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Frequent monitoring of vitals, Strict IO charting, Flat bed without pillow for SA, NPO depending on type of anaesthesia and surgery.

checkpoint.name: Vitamin K for low birth weight
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Given to all new born (1.0 mg IM in > 1500 gms and 0.5 mg in < 1500 gms

checkpoint.name: New born Resuscitation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask Nursing staff to demonstrate Resuscitation Technique

checkpoint.name: Recording date and Time of Birth, Weight
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the records

checkpoint.name: Foot prints of the new-born taken
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: check the records.

checkpoint.name: Essential new born care given to all new born.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Dried With a clean towel from head to feet and put on mothers abdomen, Care of Cord and Eyes ,Warmth, Kangaroo Mother Care, Check use of radiant warmer, Delayed Cord Clamping, Clamps & Cut the cords by sterile instruments within 1-3 minutes of Birth 
Clean baby's eyes with sterile cotton/Gauge ,Observe /Ask staff about the practice

checkpoint.name: Management of PIH/Eclampsia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask for how to secure airway and breathing, Loading and Maintenance dose of Magnesium sulphate , Administration of anti Hypertensive Drugs

checkpoint.name: Postpartum Haemorrhage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: IV fluids, parental oxytocin and antibiotics, manual removal of placenta, blood transfusion, B-lynch suturing, surgery

checkpoint.name: Retained Placenta
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: manual removal of placenta and surgery.

checkpoint.name: Ruptured Uterus
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Put patient in left lateral position, maintain Airway, breathing and circulation, IV Fluid, antibiotics, urgent laparotomy and hysterectomy.

checkpoint.name: Sepsis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: IV Fluids and IV antibiotics.

checkpoint.name: Staff is aware of disaster plan & Role and responsibilities of staff in disaster is defined
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask role of staff in case of disaster.

checkpoint.name: There is procedure to ensure that PAC has been done before surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: There is procedure to review findings of PAC

checkpoint.name: Minimum PAC for emergency cases
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: in emergency & life saving conditions, surgery may be started with General physical examination of the patient & sending the sample for lab. Examination

checkpoint.name: Post anaesthesia status is monitored and documented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for anaesthetic notes & post operating instructions in post operative room & area

checkpoint.name: Anaesthesia equipment are checked before induction
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Sufficient reserve of gases. Vaporizers are connected, Laryngoscope, ET tube and suction App are ready and clean

checkpoint.name: Any adverse Anaesthesia Event is recorded and reported
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Reduced level of consciousness, reparatory depression, malignant hyperpyrexia, bone marrow depression, life threatening pressure effect, anaphylaxis

checkpoint.name: Anaesthesia Safety Checklist is used for safe administration of anaesthesia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check use of WHO Anaesthesia Safety Checklist

checkpoint.name: Patients vitals are recorded during anaesthesia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Heart rate , cardiac rate , BP, O2 Saturation, temperature, Respiration rate.

checkpoint.name: Potency and level of anaesthesia is monitored
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Recorded in the Anaesthesia Record Form.

checkpoint.name: Anaesthesia note is recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for the adequacy, signed, complete, and post anaesthesia instructions.

checkpoint.name: Food intake status of Patient is checked
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Time of last food intake is mentioned

checkpoint.name: Anaesthesia plan is documented before starting surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Type of anaesthesia planned-local/general/spinal/epidural. Time is mentioned on all entries of anaesthesia monitoring sheet

checkpoint.name: Airway security is ensured
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Breathing system of anaesthesia equipment that delivers gas to the patient is securely and correctly assembled and breathing circuits are clean

checkpoint.name: Death note including efforts done for resuscitation is noted in patient record
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Includes both maternal and neonatal death. Death summary is given to patient attendant quoting the immediate cause and underlying cause if possible

checkpoint.name: Sponge and Instrument Count Practice is implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Instrument, needles and sponges are counted before beginning of case, before final closure and on completing of procedure & documented

checkpoint.name: Surgical Safety Check List is used for each surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Surgical safety check list has been used for surgical procedures

checkpoint.name: Appropriate suture material is used for surgery as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: For closing abdominal wall or ligating blood vessel use non-absorbable sutures (braided suture, nylon, polyester etc). absorbable sutures in urinary tract. Braided Biological sutures are not used for dirty wounds, Catgut is not used for closing fascial layers of abdominal wounds or where prolonged support is required

checkpoint.name: Check for suturing techniques are applied as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Braided sutures for interrupted stiches. Absorbable and non-absorbable monofilament sutures for continuous stiches.

checkpoint.name: Adequate Haemostasis is secured during surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for functional Cautery, use of artery forceps and suture ligation techniques

checkpoint.name: Operation list is sent to OT well in advance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: By 12:00 hours, a day before the surgery.

checkpoint.name: The operation list does not exceed the time allocated to it.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: this does not refer to the time during an operation of an individual patient

checkpoint.name: List of Elective Surgeries for the day is prepared and displayed outside OT.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Surgery list is prepared in consonance with availability of the OT hours and patients requirement.

checkpoint.name: Surgery list is complete in all respect
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Day, date and time of surgeries.
Name, Age, Gender of patients.
Clear description of the procedure ( name of procedure which side, )
Name of the surgeon & anaesthetist.
Major or minor case.

checkpoint.name: Surgery list is informed to surgeon and ward sister.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Physically or by email. Not telephonically.

checkpoint.name: Draping is done as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Scrub, gown and glove before covering the patient with sterile drapes. Leave uncovered only the operative field and those areas necessary for the maintenance of anaesthesia.

checkpoint.name: There is a process to prevent wrong site and wrong surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Surgical Site is marked before entering into OT

checkpoint.name: Surgeries planned under local anaesthesia/Regional Block sensitivity test is done
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: lidocaine sensitivity test

checkpoint.name: Patient evaluation before surgery is done and recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Vitals , Patients fasting status etc.

checkpoint.name: Antibiotic Prophylaxis and Tetanus given as indicated
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: As per instructions of surgeon/anaesthetist.

checkpoint.name: Skin preparation is done as per protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Prepare the skin with antiseptic solution (Chlorhexidine gluconate and iodine), starting in the centre and moving out to the periphery. This area should be large enough to include the entire incision and an adjacent working area.

checkpoint.name: Skin preparation before surgery is done.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Bathing with soap and water prior to surgery in ward.

checkpoint.name: No shaving of the surgical site
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Only clipping on the day of surgery in OT is done

checkpoint.name: Post operative monitoring is done before discharging to ward
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for post operative operation room /area is used and patients are not immediately shifted to wards after surgery

checkpoint.name: Information & instructions are given to nursing staff before shifting the patient to the ward from the OT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Instructions given by surgeon and anaesthetist.

checkpoint.name: Post operative notes and orders are recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Post operative notes contains Vital signs, Pain control, Rate and type of IV fluids, Urine and Gastrointestinal fluid output, other medications and Laboratory investigations

checkpoint.name: Patient Vitals are monitored and recorded periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for use of cardiac monitor/multi parameter

checkpoint.name: Patient hand over is given during the change in the shift
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Handover register is maintained

checkpoint.name: There is a process for ensuring the identification before any clinical procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patient id band/ verbal confirmation etc. At least two identifiers are used.

checkpoint.name: Container is labelled properly after the sample collection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: including Specimen for HPE & biopsy. Name, Age, Sex, date, UHID

checkpoint.name: OT is provided with the critical value of different test
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Critical values are displayed.

checkpoint.name: Any adverse drug reaction is recorded and reported
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for ADR forms and records.

checkpoint.name: Drugs are checked for expiry and other inconsistency before administration
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for any open single dose vial with left over content intended to be used later on. In multi dose vial needle is not left in the septum

checkpoint.name: Every Medical advice and procedure is accompanied with date , time and signature
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for pre-op, Procedure and Post op notes and instructions.

checkpoint.name: Check for the writing, It comprehendible by the clinical staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask OT/Ward staff to read the orders written by doctor.

checkpoint.name: Maximum dose of high alert drugs are defined and communicated & there is process to ensure that right doses of high alert drugs are only given
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Value for maximum doses as per age, weight and diagnosis are available with nursing station and doctor. A system of independent double check before administration, Error prone medical abbreviations are avoided

checkpoint.name: High alert drugs available in department are identified
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Electrolytes like Potassium chloride, Opioids, Neuro muscular blocking agent, Anti thrombolytic agent, insulin, warfarin, Heparin, Adrenergic agonist etc. as applicable

checkpoint.name: Administration of medicines done after ensuring right patient, right drugs , right dose, right route, right time
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about 5 Rs and how they ensure its compliance.

checkpoint.name: There is established criteria for shifting new born to SNCU
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: only the new born requiring intensive care should be transferred to SNCU

checkpoint.name: Prevention of Hypothermia
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Skin contact, Kangaroo mother care, radiant warmer, warm clothes.

checkpoint.name: Initiation of Breastfeeding with in 1 Hour
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Shall be initiated as early as possible and exclusive breast feeding

checkpoint.name: Vulnerable patients are identified and measures are taken to protect them from any harm
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the measure taken to prevent new born theft, sweeping of baby or fall

checkpoint.name: High risk patients are identified and treatment given on priority
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: HIV, Infectious cases

checkpoint.name: Personal protective kit for infectious patients
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Disposable surgery kit for HIV patients

checkpoint.name: Sterile s gloves are available at OT and Critical areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Availability of gum boots
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Use of elbow length gloves for obstetrical purpose
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Availability of gown/ Apron
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Availability of Caps
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Availability of Masks
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: In adequate quantity, as per load

checkpoint.name: Compliance to correct method of wearing and removing the gloves
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Adherence to standard technique so that sterile area is not in contact with unsterile at any given point of time.

checkpoint.name: Compliance to standard technique of wearing and removing of gown
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Adherence to standard technique so that sterile area is not in contact with unsterile at any given point of time.

checkpoint.name: No reuse of disposable gloves, Masks, caps and aprons.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check Autoclaving/sterilization records.

checkpoint.name: Availability of cleaning agent as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hospital grade phenyl, disinfectant detergent solution

checkpoint.name: Availability of disinfectant as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Chlorine solution, Glutaraldehyde, carbolic acid , fumigation material

checkpoint.name: Positive Pressure in OT
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: OT to have an independent air handling unit with controlled ventilation such that the lay-up room and the OT table is under positive pressure

checkpoint.name: Adequate air exchanges are maintained
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Independent AHU also allows to maintain required number of Air exchange side. 20-25.

checkpoint.name: Facility layout ensures separation of routes for clean and dirty items
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Facility layout ensures separation of general traffic from patient traffic. Separate disposal zone

checkpoint.name: CSSD/TSSU has demarcated separate area for receiving dirty items, processes, keeping clean and sterile items
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Sterile & unsterile store are separately.

checkpoint.name: Provision of natural light.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Windows with intact glass.

checkpoint.name: Floors and wall surfaces of OT are easily cleanable
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Tiles with rounded corners.

checkpoint.name: Staff is trained for preparing cleaning solution as per standard procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask the staff to demonstrate.

checkpoint.name: Entry to sterile zone is permitted only after hand washing, change of clothes, gowning & PPE
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: only persons really required are allowed to enter the sterile zone

checkpoint.name: Fumigation as per schedule
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: check that Formalin is not used. safer commercially available disinfectants such as Bacillicidal are used for fumigation

checkpoint.name: External foot wares are restricted
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: adequate numbers are available at the entrance

checkpoint.name: Cleaning of patient care area with detergent solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: washing of floor with luke warm water and detergent.

checkpoint.name: Cleaning equipment's like broom are not used in patient care areas
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look in janitors closet

checkpoint.name: Standard practice of mopping and scrubbing are followed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Use of three bucket system for mopping

checkpoint.name: Spill management protocols are implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: spill management kit. staff training, protocol displayed

checkpoint.name: Staff aware of when to hand wash
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask for 5 moments of hand washing

checkpoint.name: Adequate preparation for surgical scrub.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check Finger nails of staff. They should not reach beyond finger tip. No nail polish or artificial nails. All jewellery on the fingers, wrists and arms should be removed. All jewellery on the fingers, wrists and arms should be removed. Adjust water to a comfortable temperature.

checkpoint.name: Adherence to Surgical scrub method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
procedure should be repeated several times so that the scrub lasts for 3 to 5
minutes. hands must always be kept above elbow level. The hands and forearms should be dried with a sterile towel only.

checkpoint.name: use of antibiotic soap/liquid
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: check adequate quantity of antibiotic soap/Chlorhexidine solution is available and used.

checkpoint.name: Check sterile field is maintained during surgery
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Surgical site covered with sterile drapes, sterile instruments are kept within the sterile field.

checkpoint.name: Proper cleaning of procedure site with antisepsis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: like before giving IM/IV injection, drawing blood, putting Intravenous and urinary catheter

checkpoint.name: Availability of Antiseptic Solutions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Povidine iodine solution

checkpoint.name: Hand washing sink is wide and deep enough to prevent splashing and retention of water
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Tap should be approx. 96 cm from the ground.

checkpoint.name: Display of Hand washing Instruction at Point of Use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Prominently displayed above the hand washing facility , preferably in Local language

checkpoint.name: Availability of antiseptic soap with soap dish/ liquid antiseptic with dispenser.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability/ Ask staff if the supply is adequate and uninterrupted.

checkpoint.name: Availability of elbow operated taps
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: elbow /foot operated or sensor

checkpoint.name: Availability of hand washing with running Water Facility at Point of Use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for availability of wash basin near the point of use Ask to Open the tap. Ask Staff water supply is regular

checkpoint.name: Check for Doctors are aware of Hospital Antibiotic Policy
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Antibiotics prescribed are in line with Antibiotic Policy.

checkpoint.name: There is procedure for immunization medical check-up of the staff
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hepatitis B, Tetanus Toxoid etc

checkpoint.name: There is procedure to report cases of Hospital acquired infection
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Patients are observed for any sign and symptoms of HAI like fever, purulent discharge from surgical site .

checkpoint.name: Regular monitoring of infection control practices
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hand washing and infection control audits done at periodic intervals

checkpoint.name: Surface and environment samples are taken for microbiological surveillance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Swab are taken from infection prone surfaces

checkpoint.name: Autoclaving of instruments is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about temperature, pressure and time

checkpoint.name: Autoclaved dressing material is used
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Cotton, Gauze, bandages.

checkpoint.name: Regular validation of sterilization through biological indictor
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Bacillus Thermophilus spores are used, for measuring biological performance of autoclaving process. Performed monthly. Label the spore ampule, place in horizontal position, kept at the bottom or farthest part of autoclave

checkpoint.name: Sterility of autoclaved packs is maintained during storage
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Sterile packs are kept in clean, dust free, moist free environment.

checkpoint.name: Glutaraldehyde solution is changed as per manufacturer instructions
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Date of preparation & due date of change of solution is mentioned on container and staff is aware of When to change the chemical.

checkpoint.name: Autoclaved linen are used for procedure
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Gowns, draw sheets etc.

checkpoint.name: Chemical sterilization of instruments/equipment's is done as per protocols
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask staff about method, concentration and contact time required for chemical sterilization.

checkpoint.name: Maintenance of records of sterilization
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Autoclave Register have column: Date, Time started, Time finished, Temp, pressure, Autoclave tape, spore test,

checkpoint.name: There is a procedure to ensure the traceability of sterilized packs
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Each Sterilized pack is marked with Date/Time of sterilization, contents, name/signature of the Technician,

checkpoint.name: Regular validation of sterilization through chemical indicators
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Indicators (temperature sensitive tape) that change colour after being exposed to certain temperature.

checkpoint.name: Instruments are packed as per standard protocol
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for Window of autoclave drum is closed, drum is not filled more than 3/4th, instruments are not hinged,

checkpoint.name: Equipment and instruments are sterilized after each use as per requirement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Autoclaving/Chemical Sterilization

checkpoint.name: Proper handling of Soiled and infected linen
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: No sorting ,Rinsing or sluicing at Point of use/ sterile area

checkpoint.name: Cleaning of instruments after use
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask staff how they clean the instruments like ambubag, suction canulae, Surgical Instruments 
(Soaking in 0.5% Chlorine Solution, Wiping with 0.5% Chlorine Solution or 70% Alcohol as applicable )

checkpoint.name: Staff know how to make disinfectant solution
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Carbolic acid, chlorine solution, glutaraldehyde or any other disinfectant used

checkpoint.name: Decontamination of operating & Procedure surfaces
checkpoint.meansOfVerification:
Ask staff about how they decontaminate the procedure surface like OT Table, Stretcher/Trolleys etc. 
(Wiping with .5% Chlorine solution)

checkpoint.name: Availability of Non chlorinated plastic colour coded plastic bags
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Uninterrupted supply.

checkpoint.name: There is no mixing of infectious and general waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: See if it has been used or just lying idle

checkpoint.name: Availability of colour coded bins at point of waste generation
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Adequate number. Covered. Foot operated.

checkpoint.name: Segrattion of Anatomical and soiled waste in Yellow Bin
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the bins.

checkpoint.name: Display of work instructions for segregation and handling of Biomedical waste
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Pictoral and in local language

checkpoint.name: Segregation of infected plastic waste in red bin
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check the bins.

checkpoint.name: Glass sharps are disposed in Blue coded Card board box
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Boxes are thick enough to avoid sharp injuries.

checkpoint.name: Availability of puncture proof box
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Should be available nears the point of generation like nursing station and injection room

checkpoint.name: Availability of post exposure prophylaxis
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Ask if available. Where it is stored and who is in charge of that.

checkpoint.name: Staff knows what to do in condition of needle stick injury
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff knows what to do in case of shape injury. Whom to report. See if any reporting has been done

checkpoint.name: Availability of functional needle cutters
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: See if it has been used or just lying idle

checkpoint.name: Check bins are not overfilled
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Not more than two-third.

checkpoint.name: Mercury Spill management Kit is available
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Hospital should aspire to be mercury free. If used than Hg spill management kit should be available with gloves, cap, mask, goggles, polybag, Glass container with water, torch.

checkpoint.name: Disinfection of liquid waste before disposal
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Through Local Disinfection

checkpoint.name: Staff aware of mercury spill management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: aspire for mercury free hospital. If used

checkpoint.name: Transportation of bio medical waste is done in close container/trolley
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: when the patient traffic is minimal.

checkpoint.name: Non value adding activities are identified
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Non value adding activities are wastes. In these steps resources are expended, delays occur, and no value is added to the service.

checkpoint.name: Processes are improved & implemented
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Look for the improvements made in the critical process.

checkpoint.name: Process mapping of critical processes done
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Critical process are the ones where is some problem-delays, errors, cost, time, etc. and improvement will make our process effective and efficient.

checkpoint.name: Action plan prepared
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: with details of action, responsibility, time line and Feedback mechanism.

checkpoint.name: Check correction & corrective actions are taken
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: PDCA

checkpoint.name: Non Compliance are enumerated and recorded
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check points having scores of 0 and 1.

checkpoint.name: Internal assessment is done at periodic interval
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: At least quarterly for critical departments. Others bi-annual.

checkpoint.name: Advance quality improvement method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Six sigma, lean.

checkpoint.name: Basic quality improvement method
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: PDCA & 5S

checkpoint.name: 7 basic tools of Quality
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Minimum 2 applicable tools are used in each department

checkpoint.name: There is a designated departmental nodal person for coordinating Quality Assurance activities
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Can be senior surgeon or anaesthetist.

checkpoint.name: Quality circle has bee formed in the operation theatre
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check if quality circle formed and functional in the OT

checkpoint.name: There is system of daily round by matron/hospital manager/ hospital superintendent/ OT in charge for monitoring of services
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check for entries in Round Register.

checkpoint.name: Departmental checklist are used for monitoring and quality assurance
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Staff is designated for filling and monitoring of these checklists

checkpoint.name: Check periodic assessment of medication and patient care safety risk is done using defined checklist periodically
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Verify with the records. A comprehensive risk assessment of all clinical processes should be done using pre define criteria at least once in three month.

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for specific processes to the department
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for data collection, analysis & use for improvement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for support services & facility management.
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for safety & risk management
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.name: Department has documented procedure for ensuring patients rights including consent, privacy, confidentiality & entitlement
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: Check SOP for adequacy

checkpoint.name: Work instruction/clinical protocols are displayed
checkpoint.meansOfVerification: processing and sterilization of equipment's,
